contentrichtext.text: This is a list of Japanese Navy battleships from 1860 to 1945. Dates are launching dates. ==Early battleships== * {{ship|Japanese ironclad|Fusō||2}} (1877) - BU 1910 * {{ship|Japanese battleship|Chin'en||2}} (1882) (ex-Chinese {{ship|Chinese turret ship|Zhenyuan||2}}, captured 1895) - BU 1914 ==Pre-Dreadnoughts== * {{sclass-|Fuji|battleship|4}} ** {{ship|Japanese battleship|Fuji||2}} (1896) - BU 1948 ** {{ship|Japanese battleship|Yashima||2}} (1896) - Mined 1904 * {{sclass-|Shikishima|battleship|4}} ** {{ship|Japanese battleship|Shikishima||2}} (1898) - BU 1948 ** {{ship|Japanese battleship|Hatsuse||2}} (1899) - Mined 1904 * {{ship|Japanese battleship|Asahi||2}} (1899) - Sunk 1942 * {{ship|Japanese battleship|Mikasa||2}} (1900) - Preserved [[Yokosuka]] * {{ship|Japanese battleship|Iki||2}} (1889) (ex-Russian {{ship|Russian battleship|Imperator Nikolai I||2}}, captured 1905) - sunk as target 1915 * {{ship|Japanese battleship|Tango||2}} (1894) (ex-Russian {{ship|Russian battleship|Poltava||2}}, captured 1905) - BU 1923 * {{ship|Japanese battleship|Sagami||2}} (1898) (ex-Russian {{ship|Russian battleship|Peresvet||2}}, captured 1905) * {{ship|Japanese battleship|Suwo||2}} (1900) (ex-Russian {{ship|Russian battleship|Pobieda||2}}, captured 1905) * {{ship|Japanese battleship|Hizen||2}} (1900) (ex-Russian {{ship|Russian battleship|Retvizan||2}}, captured 1905) * {{ship|Japanese battleship|Iwami||2}} (1902) (ex-Russian {{ship|Russian battleship|Oryol||2}}, captured 1905) * {{ship|Japanese battleship|Mishima||2}} (1894) (ex-Russian {{ship|Russian coast defense ship|Admiral Seniavin||2}}, captured 1905) * {{ship|Japanese battleship|Okinoshima||2}} (1896) (ex-Russian {{ship|Russian coast defense ship|General Admiral Graf Apraksin||2}}, captured 1905) * {{sclass-|Katori|battleship|4}} ** {{ship|Japanese battleship|Katori||2}} (1905) - scrapped 1924 ** {{ship|Japanese battleship|Kashima||2}} (1905) - scrapped 1924 * {{sclass-|Satsuma|battleship|4}} ** {{ship|Japanese battleship|Satsuma||2}} (1906) - Scuttled 1924 ** {{ship|Japanese battleship|Aki||2}} (1907) - Sunk 1924 * {{sclass-|Kawachi|battleship|4}} ** {{ship|Japanese battleship|Kawachi||2}} (1910) - sunk 1918 ** {{ship|Japanese battleship|Settsu||2}} (1911) - scrapped 1947 ==Dreadnoughts== * {{sclass-|Kongō|battlecruiser|4}} ** {{ship|Japanese battleship|Kongō||2}} ** {{ship|Japanese battleship|Hiei||2}} ** {{ship|Japanese battleship|Kirishima||2}} ** {{ship|Japanese battleship|Haruna||2}} * {{sclass-|Fusō|battleship|4}} ** {{ship|Japanese battleship|Fusō||2}} (1914) - Sunk October 1944 in [[Battle of Leyte Gulf]]. ** {{ship|Japanese battleship|Yamashiro||2}} (1915) - Sunk October 1944 in [[Battle of Leyte Gulf]]. * {{sclass-|Ise|battleship|4}} ** {{ship|Japanese battleship|Ise||2}} - Bombed 1945, refloated, BU ** {{ship|Japanese battleship|Hyūga||2}} - Bombed 1945, refloated, BU * {{sclass-|Nagato|battleship|4}} ** {{ship|Japanese battleship|Mutsu||2}} - Blew up in harbor (magazine explosion?) 1943 ** {{ship|Japanese battleship|Nagato||2}} - Sunk following [[Bikini atomic experiments]] 1946 * {{sclass-|Tosa|battleship|4}} ** {{ship|Japanese battleship|Tosa||2}} - incomplete, scuttled 1925 ** {{ship|Japanese aircraft carrier|Kaga||2}} - completed as aircraft carrier, sunk June 1942 at the [[Battle of Midway]]. * {{sclass-|Amagi|battlecruiser|4}} (only ''Akagi'' completed, but as an aircraft carrier) ** {{ship|Japanese battlecruiser|Amagi||2}} - badly damaged in the [[1923 Great Kantō earthquake]] ** {{ship|Japanese aircraft carrier|Akagi||2}} - sunk June 1942 at the [[Battle of Midway]]. ** ''Takao'' - scrapped incomplete ** ''Atago'' - scrapped incomplete * {{sclass-|Kii|battleship|4}} (design only) ** ''Kii'' ** ''Owari'' ** ''Suruga'' ** ''Omi'' * {{sclass2-|Number 13|battleship|4}} ** Dreadnought No. 13 - No. 16 (no names, plan only) * {{sclass-|Yamato|battleship|4}} ** {{ship|Japanese battleship|Yamato||2}} (1940) - Sunk in route to [[Operation Ten-Go|Okinawa]] April, 1945 ** {{ship|Japanese battleship|Musashi||2}} (1940) - Sunk October 1944 in [[Battle of Leyte Gulf]]. ** {{ship|Japanese aircraft carrier|Shinano||2}} (converted to an aircraft carrier, as the ''Shinano'' class) - Sunk by submarine torpedo attack November 1944. ** No. 111 (''Kii''?) (scrapped while under construction) ** No. 797 (design-only) * [[Design A-150 battleship|A-150 project]] ** Warship No. 798 - No. 799 (no names, plan-only) Note: BU = Broken Up date ==External links== * [http://homepage2.nifty.com/nishidah/e/index.htm Hiroshi Nishida's IJN site] * [http://www.combinedfleet.com Imperial Japanese Navy Page] * [http://ww2db.com/ship.php?q=1&list=c List of WW2-era Japanese Warships] {{DEFAULTSORT:List of battleships of Japan}} [[Category:Battleships of Japan| ]] [[Category:Lists of battleships|Japan]] [[Category:Lists of ships of Japan|Battleship]]
